data.title: Great place to see a concert!
data.text: This is a nice venue for a concert.  It is big but not too big.  The hall has been done over which is nice.  There are many places to eat so you can go early and beat traffic if you are coming from Boston.

data.title: Gladys knight
data.text: Show was good.  Found audience loud and annoying. Witnessed two guys ready to fight but pulled back by their dates.  Lots of securuty but not to quiet rude people

data.title: Gladys Knight sans Pips
data.text: Nice auditorium.  Old neighborhood.  Located in a City Hall.  Perfect for crowd for Gladys Knight.  Saw Box Scaggs coming, Along with a few other artist.  Probably a neighborhood gem for concerts, and they seem to promote it that way.  EZ to get to, on street parking for us.

data.title: Great Music Venue!
data.text: Attended the 2016 Happy Together Tour stop at Lynn Auditorium, which has officially become an annual tradition! Great seats with no obstructions. VIP seating is limited, but worth it. Good acoustics. Plenty of free parking in lots behind the venue. We go early to have dinner at Rosetti's before the show - make reservations & let your server know you are going to a show at the auditorium. Lynn Auditorium is a terrific live performance destination or fun something to do when traveling on the North Shore!

data.title: Excellent venue for music
data.text: As a venue in a City Hall this was a fantastic location. Seats were comfy and the acoustics were perfect (prog rock Yes). Wonderful staff and meticulous restrooms. Parking is a bit trying - but the Salvation Army two doors down offers event parking for a donation. Lots fills quick - so get there a little early.

data.title: Concerts
data.text: Wonderful way to see some great shows locally.  Very comfortable seats and atmosphere.  Parking can be tricky, but worth the effort.

data.title: No bad seat!
data.text: We have been a few times, to different shows.  We have tried different seats, based on how many people we had and all were good.  Am surprised at the great groups & talent they bring in; nice to go to an affordable place! Highly recommend going here. Not a large parking lot, but we've been able to find it on the street, if we didn't get there early enough to fit in the lot

data.title: A blast at Disney on stage
data.text: Great group of singers,orchestra and snippets of Disney movies that they performed to. Great old theatre refurbished

data.title: Johhny Mathis
data.text: I sat in an aisle seat in the front row. The theater is beautiful, the sound for this show was fine, (I've read about some complaints, but none here).  Parking isn't easy but if you hunt around you can find it. The best parking is in a public lot about an 1/8 of a mile away. I would go back without reservation.

data.title: Another Great Concert
data.text: We came back to see Johnny Rivers and it was a concert. The acoustics hare a great and there is not a bad seat in the house. They draw a number of performers and provide great entertainment at a reasonable price. We'll be back again.

data.title: Great place to see a show!
data.text: I have seen a few shows there and I have been satisfied each time.  I like to sit in the balcony but all seats are good.  There are many types of shows and the crowd is always friendly.  There are many places to have dinner ahead of time.

data.title: fantastic small venue with great acoustics!
data.text: easy access, great seating, lots of concessions.  Lynn Auditorium has it all!  parking is available everywhere and there are numerous places to wet your whistle and share an appetizer before or after a show!  The ticket prices are reasonable, too! Makes concert-going possible again!

data.title: Put's Lynn on the destination map!
data.text:
awesome!!!!!!  great place to watch a show.  not a bad seat in the house and number of dining options close by!
staff are excellent as well!!
puts lynn on the map!

data.title: Nice place to watch concert
data.text: The city hall is a good place to watch a concert.its very comfortable, they serve beer and at the venue.

data.title: Great Visit
data.text: Usually don't do reviews in and around my area but went to see Paul Anka last week and had a great time. The Auditorium surprised me as to how nice it was, not huge but not too small either, nice stage with a great speaker system. Parking was easy and plenty of it at no cost. The venue is a hidden gem with tremendous talent on a year round basis. Chicago is coming along with other greats. I highly recommend taking in a show a wonderful way to spend an evening.

data.title: Nice venue for concert
data.text: Saw Boz Scaggs, great show, good acoustics. Beer & wine available. Good sightlines. Parking is non existant. We [arked and walked from the Shaws parking lot, with a quick stop at the Blue Ox for cocktails.

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: This place is a great venue for a concert.  Saw The Steve Miller Band and it was a great place for a small venue (2,200 capacity).

data.title: Great place
data.text: This is a great place to go to see a concert. Have seen several shows there. Beats having to go to Boston. Shows for all ages and very reasonably priced. Doesn't matter where you sit all seats are good. They also sell wine and beer.

data.title: Great place for concert
data.text: Excellent place to see a concert.  All seats have a great view of stage and it is better than being at the Garden or centrum.

data.title: Great Variety of Shows
data.text: The Lynn Auditorium has a very diverse schedule.  We have seen rock, pop, classical music, movies and dance here.  The prices are very reasonable and there is ample parking close by.  Check out the upcoming schedule!!
